alert.note: Alert for Clark; Miami; Montgomery (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN CHAMPAIGN, NORTHWESTERN CLARK, NORTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND SOUTHERN MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT... At 547 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near West Milton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Huber Heights, Troy, Trotwood, Vandalia, Englewood, Tipp City, New Carlisle, West Milton, Enon, Brown, Clayton, Union, Christiansburg, North Hampton, Donnelsville, Casstown, Ludlow Falls, Green Meadows and Ginghamsburg. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 24 and 50. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 60 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
